q: was reluctant to endorse his former boss's assessment that the decision to draw down US troops shortly after the 2003 invasion of Iraq was "the most important failure in the execution of the war". I don't have enough confidence to say that that's right. I think that it's possible, Donald Rumsfeld told ABC News anchor Diane Sawyer . "We had[ an] enormous number of troops ready to go in.
